revised_title: Experiments on a Solid Compound of Iodine and Oxygen: Oxyiodine and Its Chemical Properties
tldr: Sir Humphry Davy investigates a solid compound of iodine and oxygen, discovering its chemical properties and reactions. He finds that the compound decomposes when exposed to certain conditions, and that it forms various compounds with other elements. Davy also proposes new names for the compound and its derivatives.
